conclusion: The problem involves a particle with mass m and charge q launched horizontally in an electric field, entering a magnetic field at point P.
The angle between the particle's velocity direction when entering the magnetic field and PQ is 60°.
Using trigonometry, tan(60°) = l / d relates the distance d to the length l of the baffle.
Solving for d gives d = l / tan(60°).
The distance from the particle's launch position to point P is l / √3.
